Reviews.Title: “Easter weekend”
Reviews.Author: NigelTaylor
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with helpful and pleasant staff. Hotel is situated close to the station and within walking distance of some of the major attractions. Breakfast was very pleasant with a good selection of food and drinks. Food in the bar was good and reasonably priced. Went to the Roof Garden but it wasn't lit - probably too early in the season. Bedroom and bathroom were rather compact. Free soft drinks in the mini-bar each day were most welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “great service from the excellent staff and great value overall”
Reviews.Author: Dale B
Reviews.Content: our 4 day stay was really helped by the excellent staff. The roof garden was also a major plus. great location and the room we had was a corner room and extra large. The breakfasts were of great quality also. will definately come again next time in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeccoC
Reviews.Content: Located close to the station and the underground. Great check in, funny guy with good english he has worked in the UK. Clean but small room but when in rome it's hard get a big one but we had a nice balcony you copuld walk out on to & the room was spotless. Great breakfast and really nice accomodating staff, even whe we were late, (and we were really late) they insisted we eat something even though the buffet was half cleared. I have to say I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rikstar28
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Rome for the first time at the beginning of March for her 40th and we loved it. Part of the reason we loved it so much was the hotel. Easy to get to with a shuttle bus from the airport but if you decide to get the train to Termini Train Station the hotel is literally 2 minutes walk. The staff were very pleasant, the room was clean and spacious and the breakfast we fresh and enjoyable. It may not be located right in the heart of the hustle and bustle but it is 5 minutes on the underground to all the main attractions. The area has some great café’s (well priced) and some great restaurants (also well priced). This hotel gets some unfair reviews but everyone has their own opinion and ours is that we would go back to the Hotel Diana.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scotEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good position minutes walk from the main train staion. Breakfast was superb and could have it on the roof garden.Rooms were fine for the amount of time you are in them.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CentralPark Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last weekend and was very happy with the hotel. I checked into my room and found that it had only a shower. As I was running the marathon, I asked if they could change to a room with a full bath. This was done without a problem. I was a bit disappointed that the roof garden was not officially open but it would be lovely out there in summer. The hotel is walking distance from Termini station.I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice find”
Reviews.Author: jag552
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights in mid March, booked through Neckerman. Coming from the airport, it´s quite easy to find from Rome Termini (if there are 3 or more in your group, a taxi from the airport would work out cheaper. Check in easy, the reception staff spoke reasonable English. The room (on 5th floor) was not particularly big but it was tastefully decorated and comfortable. The bathroom was a bit small and looked a bit outdated, but overall we were pleased. The room was at the back of the hotel looking out onto a side street which was reasonably quiet. The first couple of nights we both kept waking up, but I think this was because of the difference in air between Munich and Rome. The room ws cleaned every day and no complaints about that. The big selling point is the roof terrace where you have breakfast and there was a nice overall view of Rome. If you actually want an outside table, it´s best to get there early. Area around the hotel not so touristy, but it was worth lookin into the shops as the people were quite friendly. Lots of choice for eating- at least three pizzerias immediately around the hotel- tried the Bar Washington and it was good value. a bit further away (turn left from Hotel, walk for five minutes) we found a basic but good Indian place. Overall a nice base to explore Rome. It was a bit early in the year, but Rome was still pretty crowded. One day we decided to go to the beach, so we took the train to Anzio. Despite sunshine there was a very cold wind from the sea, it felt more like Skegness than the Mediterranean! For the price we paid (120 euro per night for double room and breakfast) it seemed good value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Diana Rome”
Reviews.Author: AnnG_16
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in Rome for three nights starting 9th March 12. It is located 7 minutes walk for the termini station and I was very impressed with this hotel, the rooms are spacious and extremely clean, the breakfast was also very good with pleanty of hot and cold food. This hotel was very convienent and resonable by Rome standards.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: CorinaAB
Reviews.Content: Good location - near the main train station Termini and no far from the main turistical attractions. Good breakfast. Be aware that not all the rooms are so big like in the pictures published, I stayed in a small one. Bad smell from the bathroom - the canal smell. You have to keep closed the door of the bathroom and not breathing when you are inside it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpfull,great location for most sights,get a three day travel pass for 11 euros great value.Room adequate,bathroom a little on the small side,very clean though.your travel pass lets you use the metro,tram,busses,and local railway system.The hotel is situated nicely for loads of quality restraunts shops.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: Fi15
Reviews.Content: Great location for access to Termini station which is the hub of all transport links in the city and a main road towards the Colosseum (which is walkable from the hotel if you want to soak up the atmosphere). The room and bathroom were clean (which I class the most important aspect of a hotel room)! We were put in Room 101 on the first night which may well be the smallest and noisiest room in the hotel. Although I was exhausted from work and travel I could not sleep all night because of the noise. When we asked to change room the next morning, it was almost as if they expected it....! We were moved rooms quickly and efficiently but from a double to a twin... which was quiet... it was a compromise we were willing to make! Breakfast not great. Barman so happy and friendly even though he only spoke Italian. I'd recommend this hotel, however, avoid room 101 at all costs! :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and close to Termini station”
Reviews.Author: msjess4444
Reviews.Content: We stayed in January 2012 and booked a triplex room. They had it booked as a double room so they amended it by putting in a fold-out single sofa, it was uncomfortable so the following day they moved us to a triplex room when we requested an alternative bed (the room had only become available that day). The staff were friendly (though you could wait up to 30 minutes to be served while they were serving another customer as often there was only one person available), the bedroom & bathroom were clean and the only complaint I had was when we first moved into the room my pillows smelt like an ashtray - they were quickly exchanged. The breakfast was good although unusual with desserts often displayed alongside the cereal, yoghurt, fruit, cold meats, cheese, pastries, eggs, bacon & chipolatas. A very close walk to Termini station and there is a laundromat two blocks down the road. As there was a taxi strike on we booked a private vehicle through the hotel to take us to the airport - this was a terrifying experience as the driver was driving 150km p/h with only a car space between us and the car in front. We weren't sure we were going to live to see our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Good mid level hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: Nielsch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel with our little daughter of 18 months for 3 nights. We wanted a hotel close to Termini train station and after staying here, we can definitely recommend this one. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a friendly employee. Over the next few days we met many more staff members and they were all polite and friendly. The breakfast was good. There was plenty of choice and we never had to wait to be seated. Our room was a bit on the small side compared to hotels in other countries but than again I cannot compare to other hotels in Rome. Anyway, the staff still managed to put up a babycot and we were still able t move around so it wasn't too bad. Bathroom was on the small side too but that really didn't bother us. All in all we paid a little less than 300 euros for our whole stay so I would say we got good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Theft in my room”
Reviews.Author: zenalansky
Reviews.Content: On Sept 24th or 25th. Icame back to my room and the safe was open. 500 euros were missing. We reported it to the hotel and they filled out a form and told me to take it to the police station so they could file a claim with their insurance company.The form was filled out incorectly and no one at the station spoke English. I paid my driver $50.00 to fill out a new form since it was in Italian and I could not do it. The hotel manager told me she would keep me informed and she did not. I emailed her 10 days ago and the woman who handles nsurance at the hotel emailed me and asked me if I left the door to the safe open and I told her no and we could not even relock it with our combination. Wr already told them that when we reported the theft. I next received an email from her with the name of the insurance co. and a claim # and was told to handle it myself. I would not recommend this hotel because of the theft and the way they handled it, sending me to a police station knowing Idid not speak Italian, filling the form out incorrectly ,not returning my money and filing the claim themselves for their loss. That is why they have insurance,

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Madfish56
Reviews.Content: Having been at this hotel before, we new what to expect. Very close to Termini train station, an easy walk away, even with big bags. Room is clean as is the bathroom, something very important to us. Don't think you will have a lot of space in the room, as it is small. We are only at the hotel to sleep so doesn't worry us. Staff are very helpful and always had a smile. Breakfast was good. Recommended hotel especially for the business traveller like us.

Reviews.Title: “A VERY GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Whitehavenatomiccrew
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Diana a number of times in the past and always found the quality of every aspect of service to be excellent. Like all hotels it can be busy at times but even the manager has taken time to ask me how my visit was going which is very unusual in a hotel of this size. I've been on a family visit with teenagers or in a group of 8 coupes and a group of male friends. it made no difference everyone in the various trips thought the place was excellent. Rooms are well presented, location is excellent, the roof terrace great for an afternoon or pre dinner drink. Marco is a star. The breakfast was as good as any as you get in room with a good selection and plentiful supply to set you up for the day ahead. Prices do vary so book ahead to get a good deal...and go direct to their website.

Reviews.Title: “Bella Diana”
Reviews.Author: rose p
Reviews.Content: First hotel stay in magnificent Rome....close to central station and buses..restaurants and places of interest are a short bus ride away. First impressions last...room was clean and furnished beautifully.....staff helpful and friendly.....buffet breakfast was of good standard....Overall a very good experience and a hotel i would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: susan s
Reviews.Content: Our room was not ready when we checked in, which was after 3:00 in the afternoon. We were given another room. It was clean, but the bed and pillows were not comfortable. Also the air conditioner did not work and it was noisy if the windows were open. We also tried the buffet dinner in their dining room and found it to be one of the worst meals that we had during our entire trip to Italy. The staff was not very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Staff not friendly or helpful. Breakfast poor. Location good only because close to Termani”
Reviews.Author: 2blues
Reviews.Content: I found the staff not helpful or friendly. The food was terrible ! Rooms were just ok. Disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LizzVal
Reviews.Content: Would not stay here again. The rooftop garden is the only thing going for this hotel. Taking the elevators was always an adventure of it's own... we never knew where we would end up. There was always at least 2-3 people at the front desk, but none of them were polite or helpful. The only nice people working at this hotel were the people at the rooftop garden (Franco, Vicenzo). You can walk here from the Termini (train station) but we didn't know any better and got ripped off by a cab driver. 10 euros for 3 blocks!! The only plus was that it was very close to the train station and bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky Room”
Reviews.Author: Maura B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Diana for four nights at the end of a 9 day vacation. When we arrived, the room was small, which was fine, but there were dark hairs around the toilet and on the floor in the bathroom (gross). The room also did not smell clean, and the odor grew progressively worse during our four night stay. When we tried to open the window for fresh air... our window opened into the foyer of the hotel so there was no fresh air/breeze to be had (in fact, it smelled pretty bad out there too). The air conditioner was very weak and hardly cooled the room. When we complained at the front desk about the odor problem...they sent someone to our room who sprayed Lysol. Our room could not be changed because the hotel was booked. Perhaps we just got a bad room, but from our experience.... this hotel was not worth the money, and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Termini Station and Via Cavour”
Reviews.Author: JRB133
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our last night in Rome. It is a clean, safe hotel near Termini Station. We would not stay here for more than a night but the location was good for our early morning trip to the airport. Just off via Cavour - if you walk the length of Via Cavour you will find shops and restaurants and you will come to the Collosseum. Breakfast is good - with bacon and eggs - a nod to North Americans I suppose. We thought it was expensive for what it offered and to say it is a four star is overstating it a bit. Having said that, it is a good choice if you wish to be by Termini Stazione.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms but great location!”
Reviews.Author: 2011luvtotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2011 for 3 nights. We took the train to Rome from Siena where and arrived at the hotel via subway. The stop was only about 3 blocks from the hotel so we walked there and found it quite easily. The front desk person (Christian) was extremely helpful and after checking us in brought out a map and showed us how to get to the major attractions in Rome. We were escorted to our room which was extremely small (the smalles we had been in in Italy) but clean. My husband had to have wi-fi access for work so he checked that right away; they did have free wi-fi but we were not easily able to connect to it from that room. We called the front desk and they located another room with better reception. This room was also slightly larger than the first. The bed was quite small, slightly larger than a double, but the linens were very nice white and the bed was pretty comfortable. The room had poor lighting but a very nice but small bathroom with a bidet. There were no drawers available for clothes and the view out of the window was mediocre. The a/c worked fine and the room was very quiet. There was a good size tv with 2 english speaking news channels. The hotel is located about 15-20 min from the Spanish Steps (the view was beautiful at night) and close to lots of shopping. We walked everywhere, from the Vatican to the Coliseum to the Trevi Fountain. It was quite a bit of walking but there are sights to look at all along the way. The hotel had Happy Hour every day from 1800-2200 with 1/2 price drinks and free food. In fact, we ate supper there one night to save money! The bar area is beautiful with really nice couches and chairs for seating. Breakfast was very good; cereal, coffee and juices, eggs and bacon, and lots of wonderful pasteries. There was a refrigerator and safe in the room. After checkout on our last day they graciously held our luggage for us while we spent the day in Rome. Since they're located so close to the subway it was handy to pick up our luggage before we traveled out to the airport area. The hotel also had 2 computers set up in the lobby with free internet access. Most helpful desk staff that we encountered in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: Lyn J
Reviews.Content: This property is conveniently located close to the train terminal, metro, and many good restaurants. Buffet breakfast includes eggs, sausage/bacon, toast, fruit (fresh and canned) cereals, croissants, yogurt, sweet rolls, juice, milk, and caffe (automated machine which makes your choice - loved it!). We were very satisfied with the selection and freshness of our buffet breakfasts. Since my suitcase didn't arrive in Rome with me (it arrived 2 days later) we found the grocery store, parfumeria, and plenty clothes shopping around the hotel and train terminal area very conveniently located close by. The staff was efficient, knowledgeable, and friendly. The rooms were complete with all the towels and soft sheets, toiletries,and comforts needed to enjoy 3 full days in Rome. The floors are linoleum, walls are painted, beds comfortable. I would recommend this property to my friends and family. One note worth passing on: The A/C is turned off at 10am (if not 10 minutes sooner) during the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean hotel, very close to main train station (Termini)”
Reviews.Author: Sunbeam_Monopoly
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent recommended this hotel. We were so pleased with our stay. It was one block away from the train station so it was no effort at all to walk with our luggage from the train station to the hotel (no cab needed). The area is very busy so felt very safe as well. It was also 2 blocks from the Republica station so getting to the Rome transit system was also very easy. Btw, the rome metro and buses as really easy to use and save your feet, do not be shy (it took us 2 days to give it a try!) You can buy a 3 day pass and use all metro and buses. Anyway, the hotel had spacious rooms (for a standard European hotel of course), very clean, friendly staff, great airconditioning (very important if you go in summer). The roof top garden is beautiful and wonderful to climb up and watch sunrise or sunset. We did not eat dinner there but we utilized their (american) continental breakfast, which was an easy way to start the day. It was not food to write home about but it was filling and there was always plenty to eat. Strongly recommend this hotel as a Rome home base, worked very well for us, as long as you don't mind taking transit to see the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the mark!!!!!l”
Reviews.Author: sreeIndia
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited Rome in 2010 . I had booked through booking.com. The room was just ok. the breakfast was great. lobby was a bit small. The furniture and the upholstry needed care.

Reviews.Title: “magnificent view”
Reviews.Author: Barbara H
Reviews.Content: my family and i have been to this hotel just a couple of night. the rooff garden is indeed magnificent! the room was ok, a bit small for us (we were 3) but as i said we only stayed a few nights. the location is close to termini station but the enighborood is a bit rough

Reviews.Title: “The rooftop Garden is a *must*!”
Reviews.Author: goodwillme
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night, on the last night of our Italian honeymoon. We'd already toured the city at the beginning of the trip and wanted a place close to the train station for our early departure home the next day. We also wanted to stay someplace that would afford us 'one last great view' of the eternal city before leaving. The Hotel DIana did not disappoint. We had cocktails on the roof deck the evening of our stay and a *fantastic* breakfast (large hot & cold buffet--delicious!) in the morning before heading home. We didn't have dinner at the roof garden but did see the dinner buffet and it did look fantastic also. The views are spectacular! The roof garden is beautiful and well maintained. The roof garden staff was attentive, warm and friendly. Though the roof garden, for us, was the huge selling point, the rooms were also very nice. Clean & well appointed. Would definitely recommend for a very nice hotel, reasonably priced, near (under 5 min walk) the main train station (Termini) with *amazing* not to be missed views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: carol w
Reviews.Content: we spent our first night in Rome at this hotel, I was so upset when I saw the room, I didnt want to go back there after our evening out. it was small and every outdated, and the bed was very uncomfortable, the screen across the bath wouldnt stay open and kept falling in when trying to have a shower, and the water just poured out onto the floor. when we went for breakfast the next day, we arrived a couple of minutes before 6.30 (we were getting picked up at 7am) and was told to get out and the door was locked behind us. Unfortunately we were booked for another two nights after a tour down south and was told we would loose our money if we cancelled, we requested a better room and I have to admit the room and bathroom were much better that time, although the shower still leaked onto the floor. The staff in general were not at all friendly and the man at the front dest was just rude.I would not stay at this hotel again and wouldnt recommend it either

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LMVB26
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother and sister in mid August 2011. We had a twin room and a single room. Both rooms were very clean and tidy. The air conditioning worked well. The internet connection was excellent in one of the rooms but not so good in the other. Breakfast was lovely - the view from the roof top restaurant is very nice. There was a good range of breakfast food on offer. The dinner buffet was very nice - a very nice range of tasty Italian food, but a bit expensive at 23 Euro per person. Staff were pleasant. The location was worth the price. About five minutes walk maximum to the main railway station. Many good and well priced restaurants in the area. About 20 mins walk to the Vatican in one direction, and 20mins walk to the Forum/ Colosseum in the other. I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Near Termini station”
Reviews.Author: jeanette1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The room was a single, compact and decorated in green floral wall paper. The bathroom was very nice. The rooftop was a great place to have an evening drink and the breakfast buffet was good. The hotel does not have wi fi in the rooms, only one PC in reception that is always busy. My room did not have air conditioning which did not bother me as it stayed relatively comfortable at night, however if I slept in, the room was very hot and stuffy. Reception were moderately helpful. Location a little far from old Rome but convenient to transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location makes the hotel”
Reviews.Author: francetraveller2007
Reviews.Content: We drove into Rome and returned out cars at Termini Station. Hotel Diana is located only 2-3 short blocks away. So in addition to being convenient for those traveling by train, this was very convenient for those driving into Rome. About 1 block from the hotel is the HOHO bus stop, (Hop On Hop Off). so again very convenient. For around E20 we had HOHO access to all sites for 2 days. Overall the convenience of this hotel justify a strong recommendation. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable but a little dated. The rooftop garden offers a pleasant view (but not of any particular site or monument) and it offers a buffet dinner (which is a bit over-priced) but convenient. The rooms include breakfast. The staff was pleasant and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and neat”
Reviews.Author: Debsanne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and neat but could do with a total refurbishment. Rooms were small but had all you needed and our room was very quiet so we did get a good nights sleep. Wi-Fi did not work in our room on the 4th floor and we also didn't have the pay Tv option. Located close to bus and train lines. Personally I think the best feature this hotel has is the roof garden which offers great views of Rome. If I went back to Rome I would look for a hotel that is a bit more upmarket.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm in the middle of the Universe!”
Reviews.Author: livetotravel3105
Reviews.Content: Wow..what a find! So happy i took the time to research these hotels..and a big thankyou for TripAdvisor for helping with that. What a great hotel. I must admit the selling point for me was the Roof Garden. Ah..La bella Roma. I must admit i was sceptical but decided to take a chance. The hotel rooms are gorgeous. Obviously they have been renovated and are now so modern, clean and beautifully furnished. Excellent bed. The only downside was that the air-conditioning was on a timer which would go off aprox 11pm..when you need it the most i think. You certainly don't need it during the day..hopefully you're out and about exploring this wonderful city .A small buffet breakfast was included in our room price. It's a simple but ample selection of cereals, croissants, breads, eggs, bacon, cold meats, cheese, yoghurt etc. The hotel is only about 10mins walk from the Termini and easy to get around from this point. There are some nice restaurants also around the Hotel. But I must admit..the Roof Garden is really 'something else'!! So beautiful. Olive trees, beautiful flowers, comfortable lounges, 360 degree view all over Rome from the top. Fabulous Bar and great Barman, lovely breeze. Awesome Roman sunsets looking over to St.Pauls. A real find! Enjoy..I certainly did.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE HOTEL - COULD RUIN YOUR TRIP”
Reviews.Author: Spasmitis
Reviews.Content: From the time you walk into the cramped foyer the low quality of this rundown hotel is evident. We could barely fit in the tiny lift on the way to our small room with even smaller bathroom in need of repair (faucet hanging off and shower curtain broken). Hotel staff were rude to our requests (my wife asked to borrow some scissors and was told to go to the front desk to get them - and then told to use them there!). It is not in a central location and surrounding restaurants are tourist traps. We could not tolerate this hotel so left half way through our stay - the staff didnt even question why we were leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location..”
Reviews.Author: Star-MG
Reviews.Content: I was for New Year.. the staff was friendly specially a receptionist called Samir was in night shift give me advice for all hot spots at night.. very center just steps from train station.. all kind of transportation is around and you can walk on your own to explore all the area.. rooms was not so wide as most of European hotels in center.. breakfast was quite good

Reviews.Title: “Excellent clean and well appointed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaye53
Reviews.Content: We can't fault the customer servicing of all the staff, they were polite, all spoke english and provided us with all our requests in a timely manner. The food was so yummy and plentiful. The office staff were extremely helpful during our stay. When we lost a camera and after we left they continued to try to find it. Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable, the only negative thing was we wished the shower door was in a different position as there wasn't much room between that and the wash basin. But was still adequate. Historical sites and transport are close by. Shopping was within walking distance, we found it strange that shops don't open until 10am whereas in Australia they open 8.30am. We loved the roof top garden as we had 360 degree views. We give this hotel 5 stars and if we return to Rome we will stay there again. Thank you to all staff for making our stay and first impression of Italy so warm and welcoming. Kaye and Russell, Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not a 4 Star ****”
Reviews.Author: PJBSCH
Reviews.Content: This was rated as a four star by our travel agency. Certainly NOT. Smelled of smoke, loud, not clean and no internet w.out paying. What a disappointment ..........

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel For Sightseeing!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelAndEmma
Reviews.Content: My self and my girlfriend stayed here for 3 nights during our stay on Rome and were very impressed with this hotel! The location was perfect for sightseeing as it was very close to the termini station to catch the metro to the surrounding sights! It is also in walking distance to the coliseum which was nice! The rooms were cleaned well every day and free mini bar snacks put in everyday, the breakfast every morning was also above average and there was always something even for picky eaters! The only thing that let this hotel down was the reception staffs level of customer service! The night staff were particularly unhelpful...for an example I asked where I could buy some batteries for my camera & the member of staff just shock his shoulders saying "no"! I walked out of the front door into a souvenir shop next door to find loads of batteries! Overall I would defo go back to this hotel as it was perfect for us as we didn't spend anytime at all in the hotel other than sleeping and breakfast, as there's no point going somewhere as beautiful as Rome and eating & drinking in ya hotel everyday!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful & friendly!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Duisburg_andrea
Reviews.Content: During my parents stay at this hotel I asked them via email from Germany to arrange a surprise because of my mother's 60th Birthday. They were not only very friendly during the planning phase, but also very professional and caring. My parents loved the arrangement, the surprise fully succeeded, Thanks to Marco!! Andrea, Germany

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in Italy”
Reviews.Author: Misse43
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Hotel Diana since my travel agent assured me that she had stayed there and really enjoyed the hotel. It was without a doubt a horrible stay. First I had requested 2 months in advance a room that was inside and not facing the street. I did not want all that noise... well our room was on the 2nd floor and directly facing the main street. The room was large but did not look anything like the pictures I see of this hotel. I had also paid the for the delux upgrade... $350. a night... and it was pitiful I asked to be moved and the hotel was full of tourist buses... I prefer to stay away from such places... and my travel agent knew this.. did I mention that this was the only hotel I let her pick out and book for us? They finally moved us to another room that was very small and cramped and of course did not refund the cost for a standard room verses a delux... Well while the porter was dropping off our luggage I went into the bathroom to wash my hands and the handle on the faucet came off in my hands... water was shooting out everywhere... of course then they had to move us to another room.. The only thing they had where 2 very small twin bed rooms that where not even next to each other. The room measured about 7' x 9' and that included the little bathroom. Needless to say I was not impressed with our stay. We did not eat dinner at the restaurant since I really wanted to get away from all the busses..and tourist crowd. We did however make the sad mistake of going to the rooftop to get some wine. Every place I went in Italy I only ordered the local wine as it is fantastic.. until Hotel Diana. It was so bad that I did not even try to drink it. I gave my wine over to another couple who have thier own vinyards in Australia and they almost gagged on the wine.

Reviews.Title: “Not really impressed at all”
Reviews.Author: Dickens44
Reviews.Content: First they advertise wifi in rooms, this depends on what room you get and unfortunately not our room at this time. Told nothing they could do, and thats that. Looked for tour information, none to be had, and no advice forthcoming. Unfortunately a school invaded our floor and staff though my kids were with the rabble, they were not of course but got told off by the staff anyway. Then there was the buffet dinner, thought great, we were tired so headed off, it looked tired and almost gone, but still for the same price we were told we could eat what was left! Deliberately picked this hotel, but never again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Charming”
Reviews.Author: Hampster50
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome with a group of about 50 people and took up most of the Hotel. The Rooms were small but clean. plenty of ammenities. The staff was really nice and helpful. the location was perfect for traveling around Rome. Many authentic Tratoria's nearby. The roof garden bar was just perfect and the bartender Franco was a delight. There is a lot of street noise and you are going to want to keep your windows open. i brought earplugs and slept like a baby ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Rome”
Reviews.Author: moffett5
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel - perfect location - fantastic service!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: maddie20
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a welcome site after travelling from Paris to Rome on the overnight train. Rooms large and very clean, staff friendly apart from some staff that worked in the breakfast room. The roof top restaurant was quite good. Good value for money and a good location close to Termini station and within easy walk to the Colosseum. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL DIANA'S ROOM NOT UP TO STANDARDS”
Reviews.Author: italianvacation1
Reviews.Content: Warning!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Warning!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Warning!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Please be aware this hotel is anti-American. I am not the type to complain, but please be aware that this hotel is very unethical. The managers at the front desk including Franco and Simona are not fair. I traveled with 10 people and had 4 rooms. Management agreed that 1 room was not fit for an animal, but I had to stay because there was not another room to be had in Rome. When I left, I was told by management that the 4th room would be Free of Charge due to the terrible condition of the room. So I paid for 3 rooms and left for America. Three hours later, my charge card was used without my knowledge or authorization for the total amount of the 4th room for what I was told was not going to be. The management Simona is unfair and said that most Americans tend to do this type of thing, meaning they run off without paying their bill. But this American was fair in paying for what they agreed upon when checking out. I want as many people to be warned that the Hotel Diana is managed and owned by people that are not trustworthy. Be aware when you leave with your credit card still on file, you automatically give up all rights. They verbally agreed to not charge me and 7 months later I am still disputing this situation. So pleas be advised of their policies if staying at the Hotel Diana.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: aliceantoine
Reviews.Content: we stayed 5 nights in hotel Diana, the breakfast is nice on the roof top with the fresh air, the room was average, the bathroom must be updated, but overall I was clean, the location of the hotel is nice, near the termini station (metro and trains), the staff are nice, we were given a welcome drinks on the roof top, it was romantic.

Reviews.Title: “great location,clean and professional”
Reviews.Author: ginswiggers
Reviews.Content: stayed a week from 23rd sept-30th sept staff helpful,breakfast standard continental fare nothing out the ordinary,restaurant pricy but good,hotel surrounded by nice places to eat ,try alessios on the corner good food.the roof garden in good weather is great bar very pricey.nice rooms,clean and modern.hotel just around the corner from the termini train station, ideal if coming by bus from the airport as terravision bus stop at other side of the termini takes just under 10 mins to walk it. would stay there again if back in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Return to Diana - Excellent Standards Maintained”
Reviews.Author: karolgadge
Reviews.Content: This was to be our third stay at the Diana Roof Garden - and our longest (12 nights). As with previous holidays, we were delighted to find that our trust was not misplaced. The double room, although small, was perfectly sufficient for our needs with en-suite kept scrupulously clean by the daily maid service. The breakfasts were excellent, filling and nutritious, with little else needed to sustain 'the inner man' during a whole day's sightseeing. There was a slightly dodgy fruit-juice dispenser that had a mind of its own for a couple of days; it appeared to think that orange and water were interchangeable categories. But the staff were as friendly as ever and service efficient without being obtrusive. The neighbourhood of Termini rail station has its downsides - particularly at night, though we ourselves were not troubled by any antisocial denizens. On the positive side, being so near a major transport hub enables you to choose from multiple destinations. As Termini is the cross-over between Metro lines A and B, you can be sure of getting to any part of Rome (covered by the Metro that is) quickly. In our case, travelling to Castel Gandolfo, Naples, or Civitavecchia was a piece of cake, Italian-style. All in all, this is a very good, reasonably-priced hotel with comfortable accommodation, efficient staff and in a location that is easy to get to - and get out of when necessary. We can recommend the Diana with little in the way of qualification.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away! Rude front desk staff, horrible AC & dirty bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: SweetPNYC
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very rude. They couldn't find our reservation for about 20 minutes and never offered an apology when they found it. There was no offer for help with our luggage. The room was tiny and the bathroom was even smaller and had mold in the shower. The AC stopped working at 9 AM - which I thought it broke until reading the other reviews on TripAdvisor. We had checked in at about 4 pm and checked out at 10 am the next day and they charged us for TWO days of wifi service at 20 euros, which we were assured we could use in our rooms but in truth is was only available in the lobby. We were intrigued by the rooftop garden and thought it looked nice from the outside (we were in Rome at the start of our trip and had stayed at a better hotel in the area) and that it boasted four stars. We would advise having a drink at a better rooftop, as well as staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “After reading reviews on trip advisor we were seriously disappointed in the room size and NO air conditioning.”
Reviews.Author: HelenBowen
Reviews.Content: I was stunned at the size of the rooms, the non functioing air con and the indifference by staff when questioned, Will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: edofmag
Reviews.Content: Yup. Hotel Diana. Just ok. To put things into perspective. We stayed at Hotel Diana at the tail end of our family's European tour. We visited Ireland, London, Paris, Nice, Rome. It's hard to find a hotel that can top Nice, France... Our hotel there had a perfect view, food, service and people. I recommend it highly - Radisson, Nice, view of the Cote d'Azur. We were looking very forward to Rome, however, and travelled 7 hours (two transfers) on the train to finally make it to this world-class city. Hotel Diana was a convenient five-block walk away from the train station. Things started to unravel though just before we reached the hotel when we witnessed a moped-car accident, where the moped driver and passenger went flying over the car, breaking the mirror of the assaulting car. Welcome to Rome! As we got to our room, we were pissed at the crooked floor, muggy air and cheap-looking linen. Why the heck did we pick this place? I'm still trying to figure it out. Our 20-year old boys and 15-year old daughter crabbed for at least an hour after check-in. Soooo great to have stressful moments on big trips. Positives: Within walking distance to most attractions. We must have walked 200 km in four days. Stay away from this place if you like more modern hotels. I like vintage, but this was beyond that, more rustic-cheap. Clean though. For the money, you can find dozens of nicer hotels around the block including a Best Western, even the Radisson, next to the train station. Breakfast was awful. White bread galore. Nothing fancy....again, the crabby front-desk staff was the biggest turn-off of all. They need to find peeps that actually LIKE talking to tourists. We had great reception at all our hotels. Rome is full of friendly people, so it shouldn't be too difficult to find some with front-desk personalities, who are approachable. Love Rome though. Love our tour guide. Ciao, Andrea!! See you next time!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy; staff unfriendly, roof top garden pleasant”
Reviews.Author: lindder
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small and bathroom inefficient as no counter place also housekeeping poor. Not the best location, but seemingly safe. Outside noisy, but drowned out by air conditioner which didnt work well. We unfortunately encountered 98 degrees plus high humidity. A/C turned off 10-11:30am daily so can't stay in room. Breakfast starts on "Italian Time" and we frequently encountered hoardes of tour groups fighting for space. Terrace Room/Garden pleasant as was staff there and a decent breakfast was served. Unfortunately can't say the same for the front desk staff that were less than friendly. Happy hour drinks were a good buy. They advertize drinks and appetizers; one night all that was available was chips.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Kelhayes
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location, the appearance was nice. The desk staff was not friendly or helpful. The room was ok. The air conditioning turns off when you leave the room, so if you are out touring all day and come back to the room the room is HOT! The room did not cool off. The bar staff was more rude than the front desk staff. There is a huge sign taped to the desk that says the hotel is not responsible for stolen computers, or cell phones left in the room. I would hope the staff would be honest in a hotel... I would only stay here again if there was not another room available in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, but great location and excellent rooftop restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_Testart
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent recommended this hotel and she was spot on. It's a very short walk to the Train Station (Termini) and we lugged very heavy luggage from the hotel to the train - so that was important (we realised that after we'd arrived LOL) The room was VERY TINY and it had no view, looking out onto a wall of another building. The airconditioning was good. The bathroom was small but adequate, but the toilet was badly situated (you had to squeeze around the basin to get to it, most unsatisfactory). There was no porter service, it may have been available but wasn't offered, even though we arrived with 4 suitcases. The absolute saving grace of this hotel was the rooftop garden restaurant! Breakfast up there was divine, lots of shade, two levels, an indoor area and a good variety of food for breakfast. It was a haven on a hot day to be able to relax under the umbrellas and just chill out with a coffee or cold drink. This hotel has lots of nice cafe's and restaurants within a small radius around it, but once we walked out of range of these we felt as if we were in a bit of a ghetto, with lots of cheap shops selling cheap crap you'd find in any $2 shop or cheap market stall. There were lots of people from these shops trying to foist their wares on tourists all around the station. I'd recommend this hotel if you needed a safe place to stay in Rome that was close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: dancemama
Reviews.Content: Surprised at the size of the room and bath. Most e European accomodations are small. This hotel offered a nice size room, clean, comfortable and a surprisingly large bath room area. Breakfast was typical European yet good. Nice location and several small intimate choices for food within walking distance. The only issue we had was each evening, after retiring, very loud music could be heard...a band?? a pianist??karaoke???was a bit annoying after a long day of the pavements of Roma.

Reviews.Title: “What a relief that the Hotel was a nice place as it was described.”
Reviews.Author: HdWker
Reviews.Content: We stayed there June 11th -13th on the way to a cruise. You never know when your travel agent recommends a place if it will be up to standards, but thankfully, the hotel was. (Note on getting there from the airport: You can take the train to the Termini station about 3 blocks away, as recommended by our travel agent, for about 14 Euro but will have to lug your suitcases over cobblestone and busy streets and sidewalks. We took a "white taxi" from the airport that was supposed to be only 40 Euros, as all the signs said, but we ended up having to negotiate 50. Don't know if we got taken, or misunderstood the people in the booth at the airport that it was "around" 40. Otherwise, we went directly there and I would still do the taxi.) Hotel is in a great location. Close to the Colisseum (we took the metro although you could probably walk it in 20 minutes or so) and metro stops that take you to all the sights. Safe neighborhood, but the front is crowded with cars during the day. Good, varied (included) breakfast on the very nice rooftop restaurant. Staff very knowledgeable, efficient and helpful, but not necessarily friendly by American standards. Room was decent size and had a nice balcony, and air conditioning which seemed more than sufficient. We turned it off at night. The bed was very comfortable and seemed to be a king size. Nice clean fairly big bathroom. Towels a little sparse, but serviceable. Sufficient toiletries; only one pillow per person. Nice TV, in room bar refrigerator. Good closet space. Lots of nice reasonable places to eat around there. As others have said Est Est restaurant next door was fine (not great, but more than adequate). Very comfortable and we would stay there again. Didn't have any trouble with pickpockets, but don't fall for the people lying on the street begging for money, and watch out for them. Watch out for folks wanting to take your picture. At the Colisseum, some guys dressed in roman soldier outfits sort of cornered us in what we thought was a friendly way, and took our picture with our camera and then demanded 10 Euro amd tried to act like he wouldn't give us back our camera, We snatched the camera back and gave him a 2 Euro coin. It wasn't as bad as it sounds, but if they had been really bad guys, we would have lost our camera. We saw them taking pictures of other people which is why we weren't alarmed at first. Hotel also arranged transportation to the port for us through our travel agent here in the U.S. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm after gruelling sightseeing in the seething summer heat”
Reviews.Author: john_d_Uk
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location near to the main railway station and metro ...and yet so peaceful. Coliseum and forum only a short walk away. Breakfast in the roof garden restaurant each morning was an uplifting experience. The view of the city was magnificent. The olive trees, the abundance of flowers ...and a good selection of breakfast items all added greatly to our stay at this hotel. I noticed that many reviewers had commented on the lack of air conditioning in their room but our triple room had a very quiet modern unit by the window that gave no problems throughout our stay. It kept the room comfortable but was not capable of making the room feel cold; maybe that is what some guests are expecting. I did notice that it was switched off in the early hours of the morning ....but at that time it was not required. The city of Rome was grubbier than I remember from an earlier trip in 1986. Much of the town is covered in graffiti ....poverty abounds with many eastern Europeans lying prostrate in the streets or outside churches, begging. Many Rome cafes and restaurants appear to have managed to perfect the art of tea making to such a high art-form that they now charge 4 to 5 euros a cup. I have never seen prices like it! While entering a metro train I had my pocket ‘dipped’ by a woman carrying a baby on her chest. I was pushed from behind and caught her hand in my trouser pocket. I pushed back and she of course protested and started causing a fuss about the baby. This now seems to be part of the game these days in many large cities like Rome and Barcelona. Despite these problems we all enjoyed our trip and the hotel Diana provided a welcome oasis of calm after a day’s gruelling sightseeing in the seething summer heat.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: HeyManToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Diana for 5 nights. It was exactly what I expected - great location, decent room, great breakfast, and next to none service. Paid 50 something euro extra per night for my daughter to sleep on the sofa bed. Air-conditioning was turned-off by the hotel between 4 to 6 am. Big bathroom. Empty "kleenex" box was refilled after the 3rd day of stay. Closest metro(subway) is Republica and only about 5/10 minutes walk. Shopping along Via Nationale (by the Republica station) is decent if you are not looking for brand name goods. Brand name goods near the Spanish Steps. Very close to the Terninni, 10 minute walk. Train to the airport one-way is 14 euro. From the airport, you have to go outside the departure level and take the escalator up to the train station. If you have a larger group, you may try the car service counter facing the arrival gate. Paid 60 euro the night that we picked up our daughter from the airport in a fairly new Mercedes Benz. The driver, Max, showed us some night scenery too. Saw more than a thousand people lining up to get tickets for some kind of exhibition 1:30 in the morning. I was picked-pocket the morning that we left for the train station. 2 women, a young teenage girl and a baby. They literally grabbed my arms. I was not aware until I tried to buy the train ticket. Luckily it was only a few hundred euro cash - but it was in my front jean pocket. You must take the tour to go to the Vatican and the Colosseo in order to avoid the 2 hour wait. Also visited the Pantheon, Spanish Steps, ruins next to the Colosseo, Piazza Navona, Vittorio Emmanuele,..etc. The hotel front desk has a map showing all the tourist attractions. Make sure you have coins - 1 euro, 0.50 euro for the "toilet". I was fined 50 euro on the train going from Pisa to Florence - get this, I have a rail pass and that was my 4th trip using the pass on the trenitalia. Raileurope never told anyone that you have to write the dates that you wanted to travel on the front of the pass. BTW, even with the pass, if you travel on the faster trains, you MUST make reservation and have to pay extra (I think I paid more than $200 in reservation fees). The restaurant just outside the hotel, Est Est?? has pretty good food.

Reviews.Title: “Our fears were unfounded....”
Reviews.Author: gatorgal63
Reviews.Content: It was with great trepidation that my husband and our friends crossed the threshold of the Hotel Diana. We had read so many conflicting things about the place that we were worried that we had made the wrong choice. However, our fears were unfounded as the Hotel Diana was fine. The room, though small, had a wardrobe, a mini-fridge, nice TV, and a nice and spotlessly clean bathroom. The location is very convenient and the staff was pleasant enough. We didn't expect them to fawn all over us and they didn't but they were helpful when we asked them for information. The complimentary breakfast was fine. The coffee was really good and there was a good selection of breakfast foods to suit most anyone...though the scrambled eggs were very runny. There are a bevy of cafes and trattorias around the hotel so we had plenty of variety when dining out. We never ate in the hotel restaurant so can't comment on that. The EST, EST, EST next door was quite good. The only drawback was the constant noise outside....car horns, scooters zipping up the street but from what we observed in our travels around Rome its that way everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure they have the A/C on...”
Reviews.Author: BlacksheepJD
Reviews.Content: Our stay was good, not great. Biggest problem was the weather was cool so they didn't have the A/C turned on and wouldn't turn it on even when we requested it. The room was too hot with the window closed and too noisy (street noise) to sleep with it open. Staff was efficient but not overly friendly. Cleanliness and location were above average. I'd recommend it as a place to stay in the heart of Rome, but just make sure you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: allendale66
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. We travelled with our 'year old daughter and she really enjoyed the spacious room and great breakfasts. The staff were great and its a top location.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary”
Reviews.Author: Desi78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night only. We chose this hotel for it's location - it was close to the train station as we were heading out early the next morning for our destination. The room and ensuite was very clean however they were stuffy and very warm - the temperature was in the mid 20's so l would hate to think how hot it would be during summer - we left the window open all night to get some air in the room. Breakfast was nothing to rave about it was quite ordinary. I would recommend this hotel for a short stayover as it is close to the train station - however if you plan to be in Rome any longer there are heaps more hotels closer to all the landmarks.

Reviews.Title: “nice & clean”
Reviews.Author: bdaniele
Reviews.Content: Nice size room clean with queen size bed, but stuck in room with a horrible view of three other walls, scaffolding and pipes. Hot with no air conditioning. They told us it was not working and it would be working the next day, It never did. Sticky and no air coming in from enclosed area outside our window. Breakfasts were great, staff okay not overly friendly. Small bar area for a nightcap. Rooftop restaurant was great. Quiet and convienent to alot. We are walkers so we were able to walk to many things in Rome. Train station not even a block away.

Reviews.Title: “What a horrid experience”
Reviews.Author: Orions0611
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend anyone ever stay at this hotel. The service was hostile and unfriendly. The reception desk was abrupt discourteous and not happy to assist when advice asked. We stayed for 6 nights and the sheets were never changed on the bed and one night no fresh towels. On check in someone came in 10 minutes after entering the room without knocking to measure for a new quilt The quilt covering was old white and gold with threads handing out everywhere. The breakfast was ordinary. I would never recommend anyone stay at this hotel we were very tempted to check out on the second day and the only reason we didnt was we had paid in advance for the room before leaving Australia

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: vrabkin
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, clean and comfortable room (620) with great balcony, friendly stuff, tasty breakfast. Wi-Fi internet doesn't work in the room (in lobby only) and is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Extended stay volcano flight disruption”
Reviews.Author: travellingcj
Reviews.Content: The desk staff were helpful in extending our stay due to the flight disruption. Good breakfasts with friendly staff in attendance. Excellent roof garden with stunning views. The internet connection on the TV in the room was difficult to use. Take your laptop!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome for the Price I Paid”
Reviews.Author: Crumudgeon
Reviews.Content: I attended a meeting in Rome and my wife came along and we traveled after. The meeting had associated hotels 5-12 min from meeting site with double rooms costing 150-200 Eu. Hotel Diana was cheaper than this and 12-15 min from my meeting. This is why we picked it. Based on some assessments on TripAdvisor we wondered if we had taken a risk. We were very pleased with the Hotel Diana. We found Hotel Diana to be exceedingly clean. The bathroom was washed thoroughly daily and sparkled! The shower had immediately hot water and good pressure. Like most of Europe it is a hand held shower mounted and adjustable which was fine. The partition to prevent water going everywhere was moveable to allow baths. This was fine with me. The room was large with hardwood floor which was clean and nice. Our room had an entrance vestibule between the bedroom and the bathroom, where the closet was located. In the closet was a safe, large enough for our laptop. The bed was firm and good. I have a history of back pain in certain hotel beds and I thought the bed slept great. The old large Italian windows and shutters were great for getting light and a breeze. Inside the older external windows was a totally new, modern window which totally shut out back alley noise and light. The breakfast buffet was superb. They had the best bacon I have ever eaten. I dont recall the particulars but the hours were ample. I found the hotel location near the Termini train station to be a major benefit. If you are returning to the airport or to other locales in Italy you are 3 blocks away. Also the intersection of the 2 underground lines is at Termini as well. As for the staff, they helped us when we needed assistance which was not very often. I did not consider this aloof. For 2 of our meals, we ate at a trattoria across the street and down 20 feet or so, directed there by the front desk. It was great. They had the best tomatoes I have ever eaten. Mushroom risotto, veal saltimbocca, tomato salad, lasagna, all very good there. We were very pleased with the Hotel Diana.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Great Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: denovo111
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of a package. Our family stayed in two rooms. The rooms were functional and clean. Our daughters had a room on the street and we had a room in the back. Both rooms were clean, but slightly different. One had been renovated and the other was old style, but clean. The street noise level was high in both rooms. 5 am garbage pick up in the back, but being early risers, not a problem. Late night noise in the front. The breakfast buffet was above average for our time there. The roof top restaurant would be fun in the late spring and summer. We ate breakfast outside. Convenient location to Termini. All rooms do not have safes. We will go back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “quite nice, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: justamm
Reviews.Content: good located good breakfast, but every day the same nice room, but old, so it was noisy when sb. took a shower in next room room was very good equipped, but the window view was inside the building, so now view, no fresh air, only noise

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but aloof staff”
Reviews.Author: allie424
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel. The decor in our room was really pretty and the lights were soft and dim. The beds were comfortable and there was a lot of space. However, the shower was awful. It was awkwardly placed and if you didn't hold the shower head in your hand and left it in the holder, water went EVERYWHERE. Watch out for that. Buffet breakfast was pretty good. It's free which is a plus as some hotels will charge ridiculous prices for a crappy breakfast. As for the staff, I noticed it was a lot of older men. Maybe because my party was 3 girls under the age of 25 they didn't take us seriously. I just felt very unwanted there. It is probably a hotel more well suited for couples traveling together or older people rather than college-age people though there were other people our age staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised at all the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Bklyangel
Reviews.Content: I am very surprised at all the bad reviews. I went to Rome in Jan. with two friends. We booked a triple room which was very large and comfortable. The bathroom was huge and everything was clean. The hotel is right in the middle of the tourist area, It is surrounded by other hotels, restaurants and souvenir shops. Termini Station is just a hop, skip and a jump away. St. Mary Major is just a few blocks away. We mostly walked everywhere, except to the Vatican. The one thing that bugged me about the hotel is that on our very last day, we all woke up parched and had to grab a bottle of water from the mini-bar because there was still a 1/2 hour before breakfast began at 6:30 AM, we had an airport shuttle pick us up at 6:45 so we hurried to breakfast and between the 15 minutes we were out of our room, the staff had already gone in and checked the mini-bar. While I did not mind paying for the bottle of water, I was a little creeped out that they went in so early and quickly. This last bit is not about the hotel but something that you should still know if you plan to go to Rome, should you decide to take a train ride to Termini station from FCO, and you buy your 11 euro ticket, make sure to validate the ticket. I'm sure most of you are saying "Well duh!", but no one informs you that you need to validate the ticket and the machines you see for it look so old, your too scared to put your ticket in there because it might eat the ticket. If you do not validate the ticket you will be fined 50 Euros. I've gone through this, its not pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost. Good location, very few amenities, don't leave anything unattended!”
Reviews.Author: JESCD
Reviews.Content: I have been to Rome 7 times and this is the worst of the hotels. Location and breakfast are good so if that is all you are looking for then knock yourself out. Room is the size of a closet and dated. There are far better hotels in Rome for the price. Don't leave anything unattended. Even my scarf was taken out of my room and the hotel is never responsible. You better put your valuables in the safe. Too bad you can't put your clothes in there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast HORRIBLE room.”
Reviews.Author: JenniferL32
Reviews.Content: Did not like this hotel. It was small and VERY dirty and run down. Dirt stains on the walls, furniture was run down, bathroom had mildew, AC didn't work well. Looks nothing like it does on-line. The only redeeming quality was the continental breakfast. Best coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: cr780
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. rooms were basic but very clean. breakfast was simple but nice Amazing location!! great for a week in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “It's all you need for a quick one night stay”
Reviews.Author: svercju
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here 1 night on my way back to the airport. It's perfect and all you need for one night's stay, its 2 short blocks from Termini so very convenient to trains and metro. My single bed room was clean, modern, with TV and working shower. I didn't hear any outside noise, even with the non-carpeted room. Hallways had carpet thankfully. They give you free slippers to wear! Nice touch. The room and bathroom didn't have overhead lights but the wall lamps gave sufficient light. I have no complaints! But will say this is not convenient location if you want to tour Rome on foot as it's slightly far away (you'd need to take the Metro a couple stops). Free breakfast buffet was typical and comparable to other Italian hotels.

Reviews.Title: “HATED THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Lola28chicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful! It should be rated a 2 star hotel. Not a 4 star hotel. The rooms are small, dingy, and noisy. The bed was very low to the ground and very uncomfortable. The bathroom was small and dingy also. The breakfast is average and service is slow. There were a number of groups at the hotel and the restuarant was closed every night we stayed due to the groups dining there. There are 8 TV stations. 7 are in italian and one in english. The english station did not work the entire time of our stay. The location is okay. It's near the train station. It's at least a 20 minute walk to any major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: happy2travel1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in Rome at the Hotel Diana. The best part is it is in City Centre and about a 15 minute walk from the Collesium. Lots of restaurants, shopping, and sites within walking distance. The room was clean, safe. The rooftop restaurant a plus. Would definitely recommend to those who want a nice room in a nice location. Not luxury not bare bones.

Reviews.Title: “Not a quiet night”
Reviews.Author: CDNGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: The walls in my room were paper-thin so that I could hear everything that the neighbours were doing as though they were in the room with me (from speaking to coughing). The location is close to the main train station and within an hour walking distance of all the sites. Staff was ok. The hotel offered no wifi, but did offer pizza delivery to the room. Overall the room was clean. The breakfast was pretty good, offering a variety of breads with scrambled eggs and bacon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good room size. but, REALLY bad, lack of sun light”
Reviews.Author: Vasanth1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is an excellent location that was one of the attractive items made me to book this hotel along with the roof top restaurant. Having arrived the though these items are true, couple of things really annoyed me which is making me to give an average rating. (1) lack of sun light in the room. I don't know what's the building regulations are like in Italy. But, we were in a double room in 3rd floor of a 7 story building. But the building outside our room window is barely 3 feet away, blocking the whole sun light. Hence we couldn't get up in the morning without the wake up call, though that's manageable; there was no way of hanging in the room any time after 9am, which was annoying. (2) Though it said, room is air-conditioned, they stop air-condition every day between 10am and 12noon. If you happened to stay in the room during that time, it gets really unpleasant due to hot temperature this time of the year in Italy. (3) Though they have the roof top garden, their menu is no better than a standard Italian restaurant, but much higher. (4) Breakfast really annoyed me as there was no toast( instead they had pre-packed long life snack tests sold similar to Tescos). There is no Croissant, replaced with soup breads, which is so hard. (5) brochure said that hotel include a WiFI. But, when I uses, for every day, they charges 20Euros, which is a rip-off

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome Location”
Reviews.Author: callies
Reviews.Content: First trip to Rome and loved the location. Close to Termini Train Station and many sites. Took the train to Florence one day (delightful side trip) and then back to the airport on the way home. Buy tickets in the machines. Took a bus trip to Naples/Pompeii, long day but worth it. Recommend rest. accross the street from Hotel, Ristorante Fulvimari. Nice people and good food. Best meal we had was at Ristorante Abruzzi, Via del Vaccaro 1, near the Trevi Fountain (Angolo Piazza) Very hard to find but great family owned rest. for over 40 yrs. Great wine bar near Piazza Novonno is the Cul De Sac Bar. 1000 bottles of wine, also great wine bar near Colleseum, Carvour 313. Romans were very laid back and very helpful. Roof Top Garden at Hotel is nice for breakfast and late night bar (open til 12) Desk clerks were not very friendly. Hotel was clean and great for travelers. Breakfast was sufficient to get you going in the morning. No fruit or anything healthy. Eat gelatto every day, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: popadoodle99
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about the previous reviews of this hotel, but we had absolutely no problems with it. Our room was a great size and very clean and the staff were always friendly to us. The air con worked fine and although it was a little noisy outside, the window shutters helped a lot and for a city centre location, it's expected and you can't complain. It was really close to the termini station and metro and easy to walk to all the main sights. The best bit was without doubt the great rooftop garden and bar which was really nice in the evening. However if you do use the termini or trains to the airport be warned you have to get your tickets stamped or they will fine you 50 euros, and there are no signs, and nobody told us we needed to when we bought the tickets, very annoying! So watch out for that.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Hotel Diana”
Reviews.Author: dasherdo
Reviews.Content: Possibly one of the worst hotels I have stayed in,there was no safe in the room,the lift was always out of order and the staff were the rudest I have ever encountered. There was avery lazy approach to everything, but unfortunately we encountered problems with our booking and we found the staff no help whatso ever. The roof garden is very pretty which is the only positive thing you could say but really could do witha bit of a spring clean. As for the breakfast it was horrible full of sugar and fats, not healthy one bit even the fruit juice and the cereals were full of sugar, no fresh fruit,no fresh bread....simply not enough of anything. The less said about this place the better we moved after the first night so that will really tell you.

Reviews.Title: “For a last night in Roma”
Reviews.Author: travelingbyrd
Reviews.Content: We picked this for a last night in Roma and was not disappointed. Great location to the Termini and metro. Great A/C. With a Restaurant on top for a great view of the city in the late evening.

Reviews.Title: “don't go there”
Reviews.Author: thelmalouisetampafla
Reviews.Content: they turn off air condfor many hours. the food is terrible and the staff is RUDE bathroom is tiny

Reviews.Title: “Clean & 5 mins Walking Distance to Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: liseAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on our way home. It was clean and sufficient for our purposes. Check in staff gave us a great map of the area and tour information at check in (without being asked). Breakfast was OK and included in the rate, which we had on the rooftop.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't do it again”
Reviews.Author: sidkels
Reviews.Content: The bathroom was dirty and I complained of the large sections of mold in the shower but nothing was done. The linens on the bed were never changed and the towels were very cheap and thin. The room was small (too small) and hot, especially at night. We opened the window for air but found the workers across the alley would stand at the window and watch us. The room doors all slammed shut so it was noisy, particularly at night. The view of the trash filled alley was gross. By 6AM there was lots of noise in the alley from workers and trash collections. It was a short 5 minute walk to the train station which was really nice. The internet was annnoying. They charged by the minute and the time "ticked" on the screen the entire time. It wasn't very fast. The restaurant was on the roof top and was nice but some of the staff were rude. We spoke to others who had the same experience. I wanted to change hotels but toughed it out.

Reviews.Title: “Above expectations”
Reviews.Author: claire-athens
Reviews.Content: We were there during Easter holidays. Although some reviewers wrote bad things about the hotel, we found out that our room was huge (for 2 adults and one child 14 years old), large bathroom, very clean (changed towels every day and sheets every two days), very good breakfast, and the staff was very friendly. All major attractions were in a walking distance. Great value for money. We will definately stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay here next time”
Reviews.Author: Marciutazasai
Reviews.Content: It's interesting that some reviewers wrote such bad thing about this hotel, but haven't experienced anything from it. The location is great, in a calm small street near to Termini, the Forum Romanum, and the Colosseum. The rooms are small just like in the tipycal Italian and French hotels, but the bathroom is large enough. The room was clean. Ours was in the back of the hotel, looking to a service street, so no people walking, therefore it was silent. The roof garden is very huge, and has good views to the city roofs. The breakfast is good and refreshed continuously. We had a problem, our room safe box didn't work. We told it to the staff, they sent somebody within some minutes and he fixed it. They helped us to find some locations on the map, etc. Overall, I can't tell anything bad about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you're not trying to relax”
Reviews.Author: ErinEKM
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked our vacation through a package on Sceptre Tours. We got a phenominal deal and that's why I didn't complain about any of the following issues: Despite being 60 degrees during the day and much cooler in the evening, the room was very hot at night. We left the window open and then were kept awake by the street noise. Even if it was temperature controlled and we were able to keep the windows closed, we would have been kept awake by the adjacent rooms. It sounded like there was no walls between us. The staff were friendly enough. Definitely did not go out of their way to be helpful. Our flight going there was cancelled the first day and I called the travel agency to see if we could bump our whole trip one day, as it was a short trip to begin with. They assured me I could do that. When I got to the hotel, the gentleman at the desk told me in a very curt manner that we missed our first day and would not be accommodated. After talking to the travel agency and having them fax them something it was taken care of, but these were all things I had to take care of instead of them making a simple phone call. The breakfast was okay. The scrambled eggs were obviously artificial eggs, which would not have bothered me had they been cooked all the way. Anyone should know that scrambled eggs shouldn't be runny. But they had plenty of croissants and breads and other various pastries. The one thing that really irked me was that they charged BY THE MINUTE for internet access. The room was very small, but clean. Our bed was actually two twin beds pushed together, which I found odd. The next hotel we stayed at in Florence had the same, so maybe that's acceptable there. As I was digging myself out of the crack between the beds at about 3 am, I was a little annoyed. When I looked under the bed to find a shoe, I realized there wasn't even a box spring. The mattresses were on a sort of stand. We had to put our key into a slot to turn the lights on in the room, which the front desk failed to tell us. My boyfriend, an electrical engineer, played with the ciruitbreaker for about 20 minutes before finally going down to the desk. All of these minor things added up to a not so pleasant experience. I am used to staying in better accommodations and probably would opt not to stay there again. For those looking for a good deal, it is bearable. We didn't spend that much time in the room anyway, there's so much to see!

Reviews.Title: “in a word just awful”
Reviews.Author: teoriko
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel because it was near the station and reasonably cheap. Call it all a 4 star hotel is just a bad joke! the staff are grumpy, the whole building looks tired and anonymous, my room was so tiny they could squeeze in only a single bed and the tv. The bathroom was quite new and clean but the breakfast was one of the worst i've had in italy. A 4 star hotel serving cappuccinos from a vending machine?? And the rest of the breakfast was just appalling. Avoid this place

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience-They Turn off AC from Midnight to Noon”
Reviews.Author: Bigyellowdog
Reviews.Content: Took my mother (age 73) to Europe for a vacation and we spent 3 days in Rome. Based on a recommendation from AAA, I booked the Diana Hotel. What a mistake. Not only was the room dirty and in terrible condition, but they turned off the air conditioning and fan every night from midnight to noon the next day (however they managed to leave the air conditioning on in the hallways and lobby). With the temperatures in the high 70's the room became an oven at night. They even turned off the window fan so you couldn't get fresh air in the room all night. You could open the window but because there are no screens on the windows the mosquitoes became a problem. When I asked the management to leave the air on for my mother, who was having a hard time in the over heated room, they told me essentially "no will do, deal with it". I woudn't recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Traditional style hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aus2Argie
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at Hotel Diana whilst on a tour and found it to be very clean and comfortable. The decor is traditional with wooden floors. August is very hot, but we were able to open our windows. The bathroom was of average size with a range of toiletries provided. It was a bit squashy having a shower in the narrow bathtub. The lift was about 2 feet wide, and creaked a bit but we always made it to our floor. Continental breakfast is served in the rooftop restaurant and included yoghurt, canned peach halves, cereal, pastries, cold meats, juice , tea and coffee. The location, near Termini, is excellent, and there was a supermarket around the corner, as well as a souvenir shop. Many attractions are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsSteve
