Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights during August 2008 as we were celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary. The first evening we ate in the roof top garden resaurant. Sounds lovely....well don't be deceived. The chef refused to cook a pizza for us as it was too late.........NO PIZZA in Italy......amazing. The food that was served was obviously microwaved as it was hot on the outside and cold in the middle. There were no side dishes available, not even a salad! The alcoholic drinks were extortionate. Our room was kept clean, however it was absolutely boiling hot....cooler outside. The mini bar fridge did not work and after several requests was eventually fixed on out last day. Reception....staff were rude and unhelpful. The breakfast/restaurant staff were even worse. Unhelpful, no smiles and no pleasant greeting.....truely the worst experience we have ever had. At one point a lady on duty in the breakfast room had a stand up argument with another member of staff in front of us. Relaxing breakfast.....forget it. We would never, ever stay in this hotel again. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel, but 4 star value because of low prices.”
Reviews.Author: GatorFTL
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at Hotel Diana following a Med cruise. We booked the hotel based on previous reviews and proximity to train station. This allowed for easy transfers from the port and to the airport. The hotel is at least a solid 3 stars. It is a typical older european hotel. The rooms were clean and the breakfast was good. There is also a grocery store across the street to buy water, juice and snacks. It is close enough to all main attractions. We used taxis to get around, and it wasn't priced too badly. We didn't spend much time in the room, as we were in Rome afterall. We booked the hotel on Orbitz for 122USD/night---that was an incredible value!!! I gave the hotel 4 stars because of the great pricing. It's at least a solid 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: aquamist
Reviews.Content: We booked through a travel agent and she tried to find us a hotel close to Termini station because we have to travel to another city in a few days. I expected this hotel to be less than the hotels she booked for us in Florence and Venice because it was the cheapest. But I was pleasantly surprised that it was the best out of the three we stayed at. We have a 15-month old baby and requested a crib for him. I think they bought a brand new portable baby crib just for him. They also gave us a huge room including a walk-in closet! I think they gave us a bigger room because we had a baby but charged us the price of a regular room. The staff was friendly and courteous. We had breakfast at the rooftop every morning and they were extremely nice. One waiter was extremely helpful and brought out the highchair for our baby every morning. The air conditioning did shut off during the day but I guess it's standard practice to save energy. We were out during the day so it didn't affect us anyways. I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. If you're traveling with babies, they're very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied Customer”
Reviews.Author: vkb1922
Reviews.Content: As one of six adults staying in this hotel, I was very satisfied. It was very clean. I also found the location ideal for getting to /from the airport, and a convenient walk to major sites. To address some issues raised by other travellers, the hotel did shut off the AC during the day, but not for long. When we were in our room, I never had a problem (on and off from 3pm to 10am). Other than one incident with one person at the desk, the staff was helpful and all other interactions with the staff were pleasant. The breakfast was more than I expected. They had scrambled eggs and bacon, as well as hardboiled eggs, canned peaces, ham, cheese, breads, croissants and cereal. The bathrooms in both rooms were more than adequate (not closet-like at all). One room was on the small side, but it was for two people and we had three people staying there. Overall, I was very pleased and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disppointed”
Reviews.Author: tkapp
Reviews.Content: When taking a shower in the room the drain in the middle of the bathroom would leak water causing the bathroom floor to flood with water. The noise in the back alley started at 6:30 in the morning and was continuous. We had a do not disturb sign outside the door and the maids would continuously knock at the door and at one point one of your staff members just walked in the room as we were sleeping. Very inappropriate. Your staff at the front desk were extremely rude and were no help at all during our stay. This was our honeymoon and was extremely unhappy with the services the hotel provided and will definitely not advise anybody to stay at your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “counterfeit euro?”
Reviews.Author: Babe34
Reviews.Content: My three day stay at this hotel was pleasant, until I checked out on 15/06/08. I attempted to pay my bill with a $100 euro, and the man behind the desk looked at the euro and accused me of trying to pay with a counterfeit euro. He said"Look at the signature. It isn't \the right one. It isn't like this one (as he took out another euro from the register.) By now he was waving his hands and threw the euro back at me and said he wouldn't accept it. I tried to tell him that I got it across the street at the Bank of Roma, but to no avail. I went on to Sorrento, and had absolutely no problem using the $100 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience is All”
Reviews.Author: kcreme
Reviews.Content: The Ritz it ain't, but you can't beat the convenience of Hotel Diana. Two blocks from Termini, 3 from Repubblica, surrounded by decent and moderately priced restaurants, little things like that moldy smell in the hallway can be overlooked. The rooftop restaurant is lovely but blah, good for a drink-- skip the food. The breakfast buffet is good but not varied. The desk staff are not friendly people, but are helpful when pressed. Our room was clean enough, but the A/C unit was filthy and we got quite ill the first day-- a small price to pay for temperate comfort-- it's only shut off from 9 to noon, which I understand is quite good for a Rome hotel. I guess I'd compare the Diana to an American 21/2 to 3 star, not 4.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay At This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1funmomCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I have never been ticked off enough to write a review about a hotel, but this hotel was so bad, that I didn't want any other person to get ripped off by staying at Hotel Diana. The room was okay, nothing special. It was very hot and they turn off the air in the rooms. I have a 17 month old and this made the room unbearable to be in for us. No resting up from the heat, it was cooler outside! The first night, being tired from travelling, we ate dinner at their resturant. I do not recommend this! I ordered lasagna and it was still frozen in the middle when I got it! I come to Italy to get frozen lasagna? My husband called the front desk for a cab, and when we got in it, the meter was already at 8 euros. He insisted the taxi driver take us back to the hotel. We all went back to the lobby and come to find out the driver had paid the front desk 5 euro up front and passed the cost on to us. My husband had a fit, so needless to say we did not pay for the taxi. We ended up walking over to the termini and catching a cab. In total we stayed in 4 hotels in Italy, this was by far the worst breakfast we had. Italians were served coffee, the rest of us used a Nescafe coffee machine. We ate breakfast towards the end of the allotted time, and most of the stuff, you wouldn't want to eat, as it had been sitting out all morning! This hotel was the absolute worst and I would not recommend it ever!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Diana The Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: skilancat
Reviews.Content: Pros-Booked this hotel because it was close to the Termini. Deifinitely within walking distance even for an elderly person. Web photo.exterior/lobby charming. Room window opened like french doors to outside street view. Room fairly clean. Rooftop restaurant good. Several neighborhood restaurants very classic Italian fare and good. Price was reasonable for Rome. Not in the touristy section. Cons-Uphill walk from popular tourist spots, tough after a day of walking all over Rome. Tiny, Tiny, Tiny,(did I say tiny?) room with even littler bath. Room next door was quite large with no occupants the entire stay. No soap or washcloths,ever.. Very small uncomfortable beds. Found that the room door was left open upon arrival from touring around City. Kinda scary for me. No safe, front desk held jewelry in manila envelope in someone's drawer in office I think. I did get it back in fine condition. Front desk not friendly or rude. Just there. Would book again if I absolutely needed close to Termini, bringing soap/washcloths and nothing valuable left in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel- Old, not maintained, and Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel052008
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel we stayed at during our entire vacation to Italy. It cost us more than any hotel we stayed in and was absolutely awful. It is poorly maintained and looks like it has never been renovated. We had to change rooms 3 times for a two night stay. We checked in during the late afternoon on 5/14 and left our room almost immediately to explore the city. When we arrived back at our hotel for the first time after checking in that evening, we realized our toilet was not functioning. We contacted the front desk. A man was sent up and all he had with him was air freshner. We showed him how the toilet would not flush so he radioed someone and then told us that the earliest it could be fixed or looked at would be 8 a.m. the next morning! We called back to the front desk and were told there were no available rooms we could be moved to. We were told we would be contacted in 30 minutes with a status update of whether they could repair the toilet that evening. It was 10:30 at night and all I wanted to do was relax in my room and go to sleep. We called back 30 minutes later because were not contacted with a status update.I guess they hoped we wouldn't call back and care we didn't have a working toilet. Then, when we called back in 30 minutes, they offered us a room with two twin beds. It was definitely not what we wanted. We had a double and if anything we shouldn't be downgraded to a room with two twin beds but given a room of higher quality if they couldn't give us a double. Why had they not offered us this other room 30 minutes prior anyway? They obviously were lying to us initially and didn't offer the other room until we followed up with them on the status. So, we decided to pack up our stuff and move to that room so we could have a working toilet. By the time they gave us the key and we moved all our stuff it was almost midnight! and we were absolutely exhausted. In addition, the A/C was not working in the 2nd room we moved in to. It seemed to work in the first room but didn't work in the twin room they put us in. We later learned that the A/C is turned on only from 3 p.m. to midnight. That explains why it didn't work in room two since we didn't get to that room until midnight! What kind of place is this? And, if this was the case, why were we not told this when we checked in. Evidently, they think it is cool in their rooms from midnight to 3 p.m. It's not even summer yet so I can't imagine how uncomfortable the rooms will be when the temperature gets hotter. We were told that we could check with the front desk in the morning to see if the toilet had been fixed in our original room or if there was a double bedded room available. So, my boyfriend checked the next morning and was told they could move us to another room that had a king size bed. We packed up our stuff for the third time!!! and moved to this room. Finally, we think we are going to have a decent room. The bathroom was a bit different, the room was a bit larger and the floor was wood and not carpet but it wasn't that much nicer than the double bedded room or the twin bedded room. I couldn't imagine paying more for that room! We tried to turn the A/C on to cool off the room prior to getting showered and starting our day and realized it was not working. We didn't know about the limited A/C at that time. My bf and I were so disgusted at this point and angry that we had wasted so much of our limited time in Rome dealing with problems at this hotel we paid a lot of money for. By the time, we were able to get all our stuff moved, eat breakfast, shower and leave the hotel to sightsee, it was noon! and we were leaving the next morning. So much for getting our money's worth for the 48 hour open bus tour we had paid for and seeing the sights we had planned to visit! When we got back to our room that evening, we were determined to get an hour or two of air conditioning before it shut off for the night. My boyfriend had to switch on a button with a bobby pin to get the A/C to work!!! for the few hours it did. I woke up sweating in the middle of the night and we opened up the hotel window (which had a broken latch) to get some cool air. I have stayed at a lot of hotels and traveled a lot in my life, and I've never stayed in a hotel that cost as much as this one and been so horrible. I just checked the cost of what we paid... 729 dollars for two nights! By far, the most expensive of all hotels we stayed in Italy, and I feel completely cheated. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go out of your way”
Reviews.Author: mash66
Reviews.Content: If you don't want a shoe box of a room where the door of the bath room bangs the toilet, and you look on to another building at arms length away from you, and where there are old and dirty marks on your bedroom floor, and if you don't want to listen to other people going to the toilet, or snoring, coughing or blowing there noses, and if you don't want scrambled eggs that seem to be from yesterday swimming in oil and leather hard, and rolls that are frozen in the centre, and cold machine coffee, then don't go out of your way looking for this place.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay! too many others that are better”
Reviews.Author: spoiledbabe
Reviews.Content: Bellman was rude and service wasnt great. Location is good but not worth the service and cleaniness. I could here people in other rooms and hallway. dirty squeeky floors. Yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Aweful”
Reviews.Author: Megsy75
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a travel agent, but was recommended through a travel magazine. The room was horrible, paint and wallpaper pealing everywhere and the room was stained with cigarette smoke. The room was small and faced a very noisy street and we had a view of the hotel across the street. Our shower turned into a bath if you were in it longer than a minute. Although we found the staff of the restaurant and housekeeping quite pleasant, the front office was a different matter. If we asked for information or directions, the responses were short and blunt as if they really couldn't be bothered with us. Not helpful at all. The only great thing about this hotel is that it is central to everything, but in saying this, there were at least 6 other hotels in the same street, so I would urge anyone considering booking here to look elsewhere. This was the worst hotel we stayed at while holidaying in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “The Street is loud”
Reviews.Author: rksue
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel through our travel agent I asked her to make sure that we would not have a room facing the street. Once we checked in I found out our room was facing the street. I finally did get another room, but it was not a very nice room and the handle on the faucet fell off when I went to use the bathroom sink. This is the worst hotel we had while traveling in Europe. Its a favorite for buses.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: travellady83
Reviews.Content: I took the express train from the airport to the Termini Station for 11 euro. Finding the hotel was easy with the map that I secured from the Italian Tourist Office in Chicago before I left the States. I requested the map through an email. I stayed at the Hotel Diana for 6 nights over the recent Thanksgiving week. I would highly recommend this hotel. The location cannot be beat. I walked everywhere from the hotel, except to the Vatican. For that I took the handy metro at the Termini Station which is a five minute walk away from the hotel. Everything else like the Spanish Steps, Galleria Borghese, Pantheon, and Forum is about a 15-20 walk away. There is a grocery store about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. It's across the street from the S. Maria Maggiore church. My room was spotless, except for a bit of black mold around the tub caulk. Most of the front desk staff was helpful, especially one gentleman (Marco?) who telephone a music performance for me to see if tickets were available. Breakfast was somewhat of a disappointment with the same old fare each day. I did like that it was served from 6:30 am to 10:30 am. That allowed me to sleep a bit later on a couple of days due to jet lag. I would recommend that the hotel offer some English news station like CNN International for their English speaking guests. I did watch some Italian news at night and attempted to figure it out. That was kind of fun, but I would have appreciated an English news station.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated and comfortable but don't arrive early”
Reviews.Author: Gypsywillow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 2 separate nights in early September. Upon arriving at the hotel at around 9am we were told to "Go away, No room available till 10am". Surprised at that greeting we asked them to hold our luggage for us, which they duly did. Returning at 10am we were promptly allocated a room. Extremely small. You could touch the walls easily from the bed and the door opened straight into the room almost hitting the bed. The bathroom was even smaller, so that when you sat on the loo your knees could hit the bidet. Exhausted we presumed this was standard and kept the room. The next day we were on an over-night trip so relinquished our room & they kindly held the bulk of our luggage free of charge. When we returned the following evening (9pm) we were allocated a different room (huge) with an entrance hall. It was beautiful. The lesson we learnt was "Don't arrive too early for check-in as they clean the smallest rooms first!"

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: MuppetExpat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sept 06 and the staff spoke english. We had a group dinner of 23 on the Rooftop and the food was excellent and although a bit pricey, worth it. The rooms were nice and clean and a/c worked great. I would recommend for it's central location near the train station and lots of restaurants and shops nearby. There's a corner restaurant that we went to every night after dinner and had drinks until the wee hours of the morning.

Reviews.Title: “was not bad”
Reviews.Author: american36
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and in good locatoin.2 blocks to train statoin.Staff was nice but short.morning buffet was good and did not need to eat lunch.the air we controlled but did turn off every morning at 9am but no big deal we where on the way out anyway.rooftop resturant nice but food so so.over all would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyRose515
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about staying here after reading others reviews. I emailed the hotel and they said they were completely renovated (with exception of daily maintance) - I found this to be very true! Even though the staff was 'short and to the point', they were helpful! The room was nice and we had A/C. We controlled it as well. The morning breakfast consisted of bacon, eggs, rolls, cereal, toast, coffee, milk, orange juice, water, etc... Our overall stay was very nice - we were not there very often because we were out on day trips or out seeing Rome, but I was always ready to return to the room for some R and R.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place.”
Reviews.Author: iampickle
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel. We only stayed one night. Check-in was good and the room was a triple. In this case, a king size bed with a twin. Very large corner room. Bathroom was very large. Very clean and comfortable. Rooftop restaurant was OK and reasonably priced. View from the deck is very nice. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Diana, more than we expected”
Reviews.Author: flubadubNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: We were a family of five traveling to Rome and I had found this hotel on the internet. Our travel agent was not familar with it but because of the "high season" the rates were reasonable. The location was questionable until we arrived. We found the hotel to be in a fine location...good restaurants nearby and about a 20 minute walk to the Pantheon and Colleseum areas. The rooms were connecting for our three children as requested,and very good sized. Very clean and nice bathrooms with super showers. We did notice that they turn the air conditioner down during the mid day as most guests are out sightseeing but since we were there during such hot weather it felt like it was on most of the time. We were on the third floor, in the back, so no view, but since we were touring most of the time it didn't bother us. The rooftop restaurant was delicious, a nice place to relax, and the view from there was fine. Reception was helpful, good ideas for restaurants and tours and very accomodating for all our needs. I would definitely go back. New Hampshire travelers

Reviews.Title: “Sub standard service”
Reviews.Author: gerryatrick
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Diana switches off the air-conditioning from about midnight to 0630 and from 0900-ish to 1400. This made my stay really unpleasant as the weather was quite hot in May this year. I woke up in the middle of some nights, sweating, because the room was hot and unpleasant. After a long walk on a hot Saturday morning in Rome going to and from a laundromat, I had really looked forward to sitting in my cool air conditioned hotel room for a while before going out to see some tourist sights, only to be informed that the airconditioning would not function again until 2 pm that day. Breakfast food was inedible. No fresh fruit or fresh fruit juice or drinkable coffee was provided. I asked for my passport to be stored in a safe, but was informed that the hotel does not provide this service. Hotel Diana isn't the cheapest hotel in Rome. If I were going to visit Rome again, I would definitely stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Diana”
Reviews.Author: Anniversarycouple41
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at the Hotel Diana in Rome was better than our first. Our room was larger and the air conditioning ran for most of the day and kept the room comfortable. The front desk staff was very helpful and accessible. The Diana is located within walking distance of the Plaza Republica and several major churches. It's about a mile to the Coleseum and the Forums, but an easy and worthwhile walk. I like clean rooms with working plumbing and we were not disappointed. However, like most European hotels there were not screens on the windows (Americans beware. Opening windows could invite mosquitoes, flies, etc.) Even though we booked through an on-line agency we got a recently remodeled room. People should be aware that room sizes and designs vary because the Diana is an old European style hotel. However, again, it's rooms were clean and comfortable and well worth the price. I give the Diana Four Stars and would recommend it to anyone. Daena and Jerry Crest Hill, IL.

Reviews.Title: “Roof top garden excellent”
Reviews.Author: chezvic
Reviews.Content: Despite previous reviews we loved staying in this hotel and would certainly recommend it to everyone. It's only a few minutes walk away from the station where you can easily catch tours to see all the sights. There are also plenty of restraunts and shops near by we would recommend the one right next door Est Est Est which made a lovley steak and also the cafe' opposite. Our room was very spacious and clean and staff were lovley. The best thing about the hotel though was the roof top garden it was beautiful with stunning views of St Peters and the city, the perfect place to be on a night. One waiter especially Franco on the roof top garden gave service that was never below excellent and made our time there thouroughly enjoyable. We are already planning our return.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: RomanyScotland
Reviews.Content: Hotel Diana is in a good location for experienced and first time visitors to Rome. The rooms are spotlessly clean I.E. towels changed daily, bedding changed every 2/3days. Staff friendly and helpfull though the roof garden staff were a bit off. Breakfast could be varied, but there was always plenty to eat. The Termini is a 5 minute walk away, Colloseum 20 minutes all other popular tourist sites within 30 minutes walk. Plenty of restaurants, bars, shops and street markets in the area. I would reccomend a newly opened wine bar on Via Viminale next to Flower Garden hotel and Chinese restrauant. We would also reccomend the Restaurant Tudini which is located on Via Filippo Turati near the Termini which is always busy no matter when you visit. the staff are friendly and most welcoming. We did not eat in Hotel Diana other than breakfast but we did have drinks on one occasion which were expensive, 5 euros for a small bottle of beer (only one choice) We were in a party of 4 who all thoroughly enjoyed our stay In Hotel Diana and our visit to Rome and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location !”
Reviews.Author: pkfargo
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive about staying here after reading some reviews. The location was great ! It's just a 3 min walk from the Termini train station . We used public transportation so everything was very convenient . We had a comfortable 2 rm suite . A daily full breakfast buffet was also included . The staff was very accomodating . The rooftop garden bar has a very scenic view of the city, and there are many restaurants close by . The historical sites are just a short subway trip away . We also took a few siteseeing trips via Grayline, which is a few blocks away . I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: louislou
Reviews.Content: expected a 4 star hotel but it was more like a 2 star. Leg broken on bed,reported it first thing following day but not fixed until further requests. Rooms very small their Kingsize bed being two singles put together ! Lift out of order husband helping people with luggage at times as no staff nearby to help, Asked for desk to check us on departure flight said they do not do that until i told them 4 star should at least have this service. They did in the end after i asked to see their GM. Breakfast very basic, cold scrambled egg and bacon, plastic cups for juice. All in all very disapointing NO WAY IS THIS HOTEL 4 STAR. The only positive thing to say is that the hotel is very conveniently situated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: ccosbo
Reviews.Content: Good location, approx 3 mins walk away from Termini Station but still in an OK area for nightime exploring - round the corner from Della de Republica fountain. Use the Terravision buses from the airport to Termini (14 Euro return ticket) and hotel literally short walk away. Breakfast much better than most other Italian hotels I've stayed in - lots of choice and extremely clean restaurant with cotton tablecloths and napkins etc. Rooms small but nothing like described in previous reviews, I've got a Big Bear of a husband and he fitted in the shower OK! We paid £216 for 4 night stay and consider this excellent value for money - I would recommend this hotel to people who want a fairly basic, comfortable base with most of the 'must see sites' within walking distance. The roof top garden not in use in early spring but we went up and had a look around - you can see St Peters from up there, I can imagine this to be a lovely place to see the sunset during the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Diana”
Reviews.Author: whizooooo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at ther Diana from 19 to 22 Feb 2007. It is in a teriffic location near the Termini station. Polite and friendly staff and very good value for money. We could have been put off by the negative comments left by others but we are glad that we trusted our judgement. Dont forget to visit the Pantheon and the cistine chapel, both unforgetable. The open top bus tour is a must.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: OhioRstlne
Reviews.Content: Apparently we got one of the rooms that had not benn renovated. Although it was supposed to be smoke free, it smelled like smoke no matter where you went. The room we stayed is was extremely small and the bathroom was quite frightening and small as well and not very clean. Every time we returned to our room from being out, there were long brown hairs all over the new bed sheets...from the cleaning woman, I presume. Yuck. I think you can find better for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Patchy”
Reviews.Author: OzinEurope
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Diana as part of a Trafalgar tour. We booked in for two days prior to the tour and then three nights afterwards. Rooms were available quite early in the day Our initial room was a single with two beds, one a folding bed squeezed into a quite small room. The room had a nicely renovated bathroom(shower only). The room was at the back of the hotel and quiet but the heating appeared to work only spasmodically and when I inquired was told abruptly by the desk staff that the heating only came on at 9pm. Our second room booked separately by our travel agent was larger, not as modern but included a bath at the front of the hotel. Unlike our previous room it was HOT and as we faced the street, opening the window at night meant a high level of street noise. A request for an extra pillow was ignored by the same staff member. A further request the next night produced a pillow in ten minutes! Breakfast was great- plenty of it and eggs and bacon included. There was no restaurant but the bar provided snacks which included pizza and pasta. The breakfast and bar staff were very pleasant. The location was great and we felt quite comfortable wandering the immediate area in the evenings. We did not venture near the station at night however.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate 2 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JakeSecor
Reviews.Content: Hotel is standard 2 star - not more. Great location. We requested 2 adjoining, non-smoking, renovated rooms - and were emailed that we'd have our request honored, however got two smoking, non-renovated, but adjoining rooms (429 and 430). When we told the front desk we wanted non-smoking rooms we were told to open the windows to air out the room (apparently the hotel was fully booked). One room was very small with mold in the shower. The other room was bigger and better. Floors were hardwood needing to be refinished. Both rooms had "double" beds that were single beds pushed together so moving around in the bed resulted in falling into the crack between the beds. Bed quality was poor unless one likes to sleep on extra, extra firm mattress. Pillows were terrible - very flat. Front desk staff varied in responsiveness - from being very helpful to being unhelpful (for example would not change a 50 Euro bill - told me to go to a cambio down the street). Breakfast was acceptable. Not likely that we'd return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean oasis”
Reviews.Author: Ann24
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the hotel, very relieved that it was in a good neighborhood after the drive from the airport where we went through some that were scary. Small rooms, we had 2 because you can't have more than 3 stay in a room (even children) this was less than ideal, but tolerable. One of the rooms had a beautiful bathroom, the other didn't. Beautiful rooftop garden with a cafe and bar, walking distance to colloseum, 10 minute metro ride to the Vatican, nice breakfast, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Our room was awful”
Reviews.Author: Sandiinpine
Reviews.Content: Arrived with a Trafalgar tour group, and the 3 gentlemen at the front desk seemed overwhelmed by simply handing out the room keys. Our room had problems. The bathtub did not drain, and the design was bizarre with the shower head aimed entirely away from the bathtub. The bathtub was so narrow, that you had to stand with one foot in front of the other, as if you were on a thin surf board. The carpet was so dirty that when you walked across it with slightly damp feet after showering, it formed mud on your feet. I am serious. The mattresses were totally broken down. The in-room safe did not work. The view out the window was of a constuction project at the hotel, with scaffolding etc. Finally, one of our suitcases was delivered to a vacant room. The front desk was very reluctant to help us locate it . We finally had to insist that they look for it.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you think dont let them fool you”
Reviews.Author: jwallstate
Reviews.Content: When we went on Orbitz to book Hotel Diana we searched the trip advisor to see what other people thought as we always do. We have had great luck in the past trying this. The hotel was very convenient to everything in Rome and close to the Subway. That is the only positive thing we can say. They said they had a 4 star rating. We have stayed at Motel 6s much nicer. The room was dirty, small and nothing special. No coffee pot , no view. The breakfast was included with terrible bacon, eggs, and chemical orange juice. We switched to yogurt and cereal the second day. We payed $226.00 per night for this so called 4 star resort and it was terrible. Dont let any othe positive reviews fool you as we were. If you searched the street this is on there is a Best western and others that would make it very nice for proximity to everything. Most people do speak english in the areas around this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: bofoster
Reviews.Content: We had a very good impression of Hotel Diana in Milan. But this Roman hotel belonged to a different category. Rooms are smallish, bathroom crammed. Breakfast was so so. Nothing to write home about. 3*. except for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Diana was Perfect”
Reviews.Author: cardiology
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 7 night stay at the Hotel Diana which we chose based on reviews from TripAdvisor. The location to transportation was excellent, the neighborhood safe with many hotels on the same block - overall it was a great experience. We arrived at the hotel at 11 AM from an overnight flight and to our surprise our room was available. Unfortunately, the only downside of this review, the first room we were assigned was small, dark and smelled of smoke. We immediately requested to be moved and within minutes were offered to look at another room. This second room was on the 3rd floor, quite large with hardwood floors, a huge bathroom with tub and shower and a king size bed and sofa. We were asked to wait while it was made up for us and within half an hour it was ready. The room was extremely clean and towels and bed linens were changed daily. The air conditioning was not great but adequate and the view was of a court yard with scaffolding. The front desk staff was helpful at times and not so at other times but always polite. The breakfast was very good - hot bacon, eggs - lots of cold cuts, cheese, breads, rolls and cold cereal and yogart. There was a juice machine as well as a coffee machine with choices varying from American coffee to Espresso. The food was constantly being refilled and the hours were long - 6:30 AM to 10:30 AM. Overall, we would very much recommend the Hotel Diana and would definitely stay here again - just make sure you request a room that you will be happy with.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: amshadow1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here May 22-25, 2006. We arrived by train and were able to walk to the hotel instead of having to catch a cab, which was nice. The hotel is also in walking distance to the Roman Forum, great restaurants, and lots of shopping-a big plus. Upon seeing the lobby I was hopeful that our room would be decent, but when we opened our door I was disappointed. The room was clearly one that had not yet been renovated. It was very small, the decor was old and ugly, and the wallpaper was in bad shape. The shower was tiny and no matter what we did it flooded the entire bathroom everyday. We had a room facing the street which I thought would be noisy, but it really wasn't that bad because the noisy air conditioning unit drowned out any street noise. The free daily breakfast was average at best, I mean the food was edible but there wasn't much selection. But at least it was one less meal we had to pay for. I will say that most of the staff were very nice and the rooftop garden was spectacular! I wouldn't mind trying this hotel again if I could stay in a renovated room. BEWARE- the air is turned off in the whole building from 8am to noon everyday so make sure to be ready and out of your room before then if you go in the hotter months. It would have been nice if we had been informed of this upon check-in so that we could have been prepared. Instead we thought our unit was broken the next morning, and after messing with it for awhile we called the front desk who told us that they shut it off.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Alison/family
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very nice. The hotel is in a great location only a 15 min walk from the Colliseum and close to the bus station for longer trips. Many wonderful restaurants within easy walk in any direction. The breakfast wasn't the best, but I'm picky and like cold milk. The hotel staff were helpful and the rooms, although small, were clean and comfortable. The only thing I would recomment when staying here is not getting a room overlooking the road. They start sweeping the streets at 7am every morning and after a few days that got annoying. I would definitally go back to this hotel. Beautiful hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Okay choice”
Reviews.Author: susanlbinn
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was receptive and helpful. Room size is good and room was clean and well furnished - even though we had 2 twins pushed together. Bathroom was a good size and clean. Breakfast was good. Good location near the termini and a fair walk to most sites.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ITALYROME
Reviews.Content: Reviewer: A family from Anglesey, North Wales, U.K. Date: 29 July 2006 We stayed here for four nights (2 adults + 1 child aged 10) and found it to be a very pleasant experience. The hotel is well located, we were able to walk to most of the sights, and it is convenient should you need to use the trains or buses from Termini station. The room was comfortable and roomy, it was a hot week and the air conditioning worked well. The bathroom had a supply of fresh clean towels, and the sheets were changed whilst we were there. The rooftop terrace was a lovely place to relax with a drink in the evening and the food was good value for money. The breakfast was plentiful and had a good variety of foods. The staff were friendly and helpful and I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Jumper71
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of Hotel Diana here at Tripadvisor, we were very uncertain about what to expect, but the hotel were indeed good value. Bear in mind it is centrally located in Rome were hotels are among the most expensive in Europe. We stayed twice at Diana in June and had 2 different rooms, one were quite new, rather spacious (again this is Rome) and clean indeed with a good selection of soaps etc in the bathroom. The next time we had a huge room (even had a walk in closet). Again very clean with both tub and shower. One of my wife and my own reason to stay was that we heard that they had a lovely terrace. And it was. The food from the grill was not that impressive but was average Rome restaurant quality and not pricey at all. And when you can nip to a glass of cold white and look at the St.Peters Church at nighttime at the same place I'm not going to complain. There were several signs at the hotel excusing refurbishing, but we never heard or saw anything that disturbed us. And there are no rooms with any view of interest. Anyone easily disturbed of noises at nighttime might find that rooms facing the street can be less attractive, but to be honest, you better expect noise living in central Rome. Aircondition worked perfectly and staff was helpful. A really good touristhotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid courtyard rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the the "courtyard" with a view of some of the ugliest scaffolding we ever saw. Some of the other rooms may have been better but we were unable to change rooms although we tried. The room was clean but otherwise it was like staying in a large closet because very little light or outside air penetrated through the scaffolding which was supposed to be a courtyard. Be aware as we saw no activity going during our 3-day stay and suspect that the scaffolds are a permanent feature. In addition the air conditioning is not turned on until the evening and I suspect turned off long before morning. This was a problem as we were planning to take a little nap after a long oversea flight. The room was extremely stuffy because no outside air could circulate given its location. This was during a period when the weather was rather cool too. Breakfast was not particularly good and we did not have the courage to try the scrambled eggs which sat out during the entire breakfast period. The location is very convenient to the termini train station but a fair walk to major attractions. A great location for access to public transportion because the subway and most busses go through the termini. The front desk desk personnel are very helpful (except about changing rooms) On the whole we would rate this hotel as so-so. There is nothing seriously wrong with this hotel (if you are not claustrophobic), nor is there anything outstanding. We did not like our room at all, but suspect that the rooms do not get any worse than the one we had. If you are planning on extensive use of public transportation, its location is great. If you were planning on leisurely strolls to various attractions, this is not the best location.

Reviews.Title: “Herd Them In and Out!”
Reviews.Author: csthacker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 4 nights. The lobby area is clean and attractive. There is a small bar area open for drinks in the evening. The breakfast is poor by American standards, but fairly normal by Italian standards. If you are a big breakfast eater, Italy is not for you. Our room was VERY small, but clean and quiet. The bed was as hard as a rock and I actually got a bruise on my side from sleeping in it. The bath was spacious, and half the size of the bedroom, but it does not have a shower. There is a hand held shower attachment (standard is a lot of Europe), but the problem at the Diana is that if you are over 5'5" the shower attachment will not go above your head! The rooftop restaurant was closed, so there was no food at the hotel after breakfast. The front desk staff was rather curt and was not much help when we needed assitance with a travel mix up. Perhaps the problem is that the Diana is clearly a "herd them in and out" kind of hotel. They cater to large tour groups who come and go enmass. Very sterile environment. The best part of the Diana is its proximity to the train station. It is VERY easy to take the subway, and if you need to leave the city by train you really couldn't get any closer. But beware, the subway in Rome does not go to the old city. The closest you can can get is the Colleseum or the Spanish Steps. If we return to Rome, I would not stay at the Diana!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, clean, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I signed up for a tour of Rome and southern Italy. We were a little weary of the location, after asking friends who had been to Rome before us, but we were delighted at the location of the hotel. We felt safe. Most of the front desk employees were nice. We stayed at Diana at the beginning and the end of our trip. Our first room was nice, two twin beds, very clean, cool ceiling and a great veranda. We overlooked the alley, which we found to be the best bet. The second time we checked in, we were put into a room that smelled , had 1 queen bed and 1 twin bed squeezed into the room. You could not even walk to the bathroom without climbing over the bed. This room overlooked the street and was overly noisy. I live in Chicago and the "L" runs close to my home and this room was worse. When I asked at the front desk to have a room that overlooked the alley, the gentlemen was not nice, not happy to accomadate my request. I spent most of the night tossing and turning due to the noise. When I got up to use the bathroom, I hit my leg on the desk and cut myself very badly. I still have a scar month later. The next day, I went and ask the front desk about moving rooms, and this emplyee had no problem accomadating me. He moved us to the cutest room on the 5 floor overlooking the alley. The room had beautiful hard wood floors. The only other thing I was disappointed about was the roof top garden bar was not open yet. But we were in Rome during the off season. Still a little too cold. The breakfast was great. And helped our budget out alot. I would say for the price not a bad deal, just request a room that overlooks the alley.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Stay - Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like a building site! Room was very jaded and tired looking. Restaurant only served American tours staying there. We were refused dinner, but found very nice restaurants nearby. The Mondial on via Torino is far superior.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Diana Roof Garden
HotelInfo.Address: Via Principe Amedeo 4, 00185 Rome, Italy
